column4: this is a load of garbage.  Ubuntu doesn't even have mp3 support by default?
Well, a lot of thought went into that decision. if you can't be bothered to run one command to enable it, perhaps ubuntu isn't for you.
During the time you've complained about it here, you could have enabled it :-D
I've been maintaining packages for debian for a while.  I've been using linux since 1995.  Try not to tell me whats for me and what isn't. astro76 thank you :)
Yeah? Well people pick up different ethics, so stop whining about it.
Take your own advice. Whining about ubuntu's default packages isn't support. bring it to #ubuntu-offtopic.
Okay. In future, a simple "How do I enable MP3 support in ubuntu?" would suffice. If you want to get into the reasons, try #ubuntu-offtopic ^_^
I installed ubntu restric extras p ackage and no mp3 yet
how do I enable mp3 support in ubuntu 7.094?
There's a nice fix-all-media command there.
Also note that not all applications use gstreamer, and that your specific media player may use libmad, or xine, or something.
I'll do a google search for you.
I assume you're familiar with apt-get, seeing as you're from a debian background
